result.execSummary:
The defendant Spenser Allen Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Spenser Allen Weber

records.addlTxt: 10:07 This includes 15CF15 Defendant Spenser Allen Weber in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Defendant Spenser Allen Weber in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich - 15CF61 Plead to Ct 1  12 Months jail.  15CF15  Dism Ct 1, Ct 2 Plead guilty  30 days jail conc to to 15CF61 , Ct 3 Dismiss.   ATty Helgeson agrees.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  15CF61    Constitutional rights explained to defendant   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct  1.  15CF15    DEF PLEADS GUILTY  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 2. Court dismisses Ct 1 & 3.    Court orders. 15CF61  Ct 1  12 months jail    15CF15  Ct 2  30 days jail conc to sentence in 15CF61  Both sentences are conc to the prison sentence now serving.

Information is filed with the court and a copy is given to the defendant. Defendant waives the reading of the information.   DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY Court accepts the plea.

11:36 Defendant Spenser Allen Weber in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Defendant Spenser Allen Weber in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. A waiver of the preliminary hearing is filed with the court and is reviewed with the defendant by the court commissioner. Court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
